alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 11:38PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Teton, southeastern Blaine, southeastern Jefferson, northwestern Bannock, northern Power, northwestern Bonneville, southeastern Madison, northern Cassia, Bingham and southeastern Minidoka Counties through 100 AM MDT... At 1137 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles southwest of Atomic City to near Minidoka. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Idaho Falls, Blackfoot, American Falls Reservoir, Ririe Reservoir, Goshen, Ammon, Shelley, Aberdeen, Iona, Ucon, Ririe, Firth, Tetonia, Rose, Pingree, Fort Hall Putnam Lodge, Fort Hall Buffalo Lodge, Fort Hall Eagle Lodge, Fort Hall Lincoln Creek Lodge and Taber. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain
